metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5764 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Incorrect pointer management in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to72.0.3626.81 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5764` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
